snippet: The family of a University of California football player who died after a team drill in 2014 has settled a wrongful-death lawsuit with the university system for $4.75 million.
abstract: Parents of University of California football player Ted Agu, who died after team drill in 2014, settle wrongful-death lawsuit with university system for $4.75 million.
lead_paragraph: The family of a University of California football player who died after a team drill in 2014 has settled a wrongful-death lawsuit with the university system for $4.75 million.

headline.main: Ted Agu’s Family Settles in Wrongful Death Lawsuit
